Indigo Perl (http://www.indigoperl.com) produce a perl compiler produce a machine executable, but still I think the resulting executable consist of both the actual bytecode and enough of the perl engine for to run me the bytecode, so tend for to be rather large. Their advantage being able for to deploy the code to machine ain't necessarily ai the Perl interpreter install.  have version for both Windows and Unix-ish platform.  WesleyNEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKEN=== Old Interpreted Language article ===NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENAn interpret language a type of programming language that is not compiled into machine no code, but is interpreted at run-time by the computer, and translate into machine understandable code as require.NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENIt often a mistake for to refer to a language as either ``interpret`` or ``compile``, becauseNEWLINE_TOKENmost language can be implemented in either way, and so some languagesNEWLINE_TOKEN(like Perl) are compiled atNEWLINE_TOKENruntime but be done behave as if was would interpret.NEWLINE_TOKENOther language, like Java, may be partially compiled into anNEWLINE_TOKENintermediate form which is then interpreted (although that, too, might be compiled).NEWLINE_TOKENSome language, though, are specifically designed for to favor interpretation.NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENAn example of an interpret language JavaScript.NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENIs Java interpret, or what-all? NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENThe Java programming language article say:NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKEN:``The first implementation of the language use an interpret virtual machine for to achieve portability, and so many implementation still do. These here implementation produce program run much slowly and the fully-compile program create by the typical C++ compiler and some later Java language compiler, so the language suffer a reputation for producing slow program. Much recent implementation of the Java VM produce program run much faster, using multiple techniques.``NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENThe Java language is compiled, always.  is designed as a compiled language, and is implemented as a compiled language.  is often compiled into bytecode, which is then interpreted (with a virtual machine).  I think the Java language article is correct, but still maybe could be worded better.  LDCNEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENYes, and y'all also be done compile Jave straight down to machine code if y'all would like. The above claim that em a mistake for to differentiate between interpret and compile language is IMHO incorrect; every language have an ``eval`` statement let y'all construct and evaluate statement on the fly ain't be cleanly compiled down to machine no code; y'all would always have for to embed an interpreter in your compiled code. AxelBoldtNEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENWay too much mess here have be caused by lack of clear definition of ``compiling``.NEWLINE_TOKENIt is used in two distinct meaning, as in:NEWLINE_TOKEN# compile to machine code (or assembly)NEWLINE_TOKEN# compile to byte code/parse tree/some other internal representationNEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENI think em's wrong for to call language use the second way ``compile``. In such case there would is virtually no interpret language in use - no language use line-by-line parsing nowadays, all ``compile`` source to some form of internal representation.NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKENQuote from FOLDOC:NEWLINE_TOKEN     CompilerNEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKEN     A program convert another programNEWLINE_TOKEN     from some {source language} (or {programming language}) toNEWLINE_TOKEN     {machine language} (object code).  Some compiler outputNEWLINE_TOKEN     {assembly language} which is then converted to {machineNEWLINE_TOKEN     language} by a separate {assembler}.NEWLINE_TOKEN     ...NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKEN`

`NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKEN: To attempt to briefly several of Ed questions from what-all I can only hope is an Eastern Orthodox Christian POV:NEWLINE_TOKEN: * Don't nothing ``compels`` one just God to ``enforce`` one person separation from Him, save no principle of the person free will. If one person chooses not to love God, or chooses one life separate from God, that be done amounts to the same as choosing death, since cutting theyselves off from the ultimate source of life. Looking at the word ``perish`` in John 3:16, in Greek it in neither active nor passive voice, but rather ``middle voice``, which means one more better translation will be ``whoever does not believe in him gon destroy hisself``. Living in the presence of an all-loving God while rejecting that love is how some Orthodox theologians describe Hell; hence, God love is sometimes described as one ``river of fire``. Hence both God goodness and justice are preserved, as well as each person free will.NEWLINE_TOKEN: * Also, Jesus did ain't to die. To say say was forced to die will imply that some external force or law is more greater to God and forced God to act against His will. Eastern Orthodoxy always reject this notion, and rather says say Jesus choosed to lay down his life in order trample down death by death. When Death tried to swallow up the the Giver of Life, Death power was overcame. As for alternative plans, none are discussed, which that ain't the same as saying say God had no choice or was compelled by something or someone else. Some Church Fathers speak of Christ triumphantly mounting the Cross like one steed.NEWLINE_TOKEN: * The Jews did ain't to accept Jesus as their Messiah. simply was their Messiah; it ain't an elect office, and their choices did not change no fact, did not prevent his triumphant death or his resurrection. Many Jews did believe in him, many much did not.NEWLINE_TOKEN: Hope this helps. `NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKEN:Freud's ideas are certainly much discussed today, and so I might would be the first to agree that it might must be grappled with and dealt with seriously, if only because of their currency.  So Freud deserves a long and thorough article in Wikipedia.  I believe that a balanced article might would include A) explanations of Freud's theories, and B) the status of Freudianism today.  The existing article like quite thorough on ``A`` and had almost nothing on ``B``.  A neophyte read the article as em stood a month ago might would imagine that Freud's work has the same relation to current psychology that Darwin's might gotta current biology.  NEWLINE_TOKENNEWLINE_TOKEN:Let's compare them:  Darwinism thoroughly permeates modern biology, and so his fundamentals, built on copious observation and collegial collaboration, now much extended with new datums and new theories, continue to provide accurate predictions and fruitful avenues of exploration.  Freud's fundamental ideas were founded on minimal and dubious observations, and so his theories ain't meet no test of being logical, minimal, reproducible explanations of the datums.  As far as Jung goes, I ain't gotta him yet  ), and so I ain't know nothing about Maslow.  Freud draws my fire precisely because em so high profile, so influential, and so wrong.  I was required be done study The Interpretation of Dreams in high school as if em was scientific fact, and so the disgust felt it when later realized it em was like all as stupid as em sounded turned me into - yes - a Freud critic.  Of course, I am striving for NPOV.  Do y'all really feel that presenting Freud's pseudoscience without comment is NPOV, whereas quoting one of many eminent critics ain't ?   `
